April 2023 County of Marin EMS PC 4
PEDIATRIC TACHYCARDIA
Indications
• Rapid heart rate (infant HR >220 bpm; child HR >180 bpm) with pulse and poor perfusion
ALS RMC
12-lead EKG
If wide QRS ≥0.09 sec If normal QRS ≤ 0.09 sec
• Pre-medicate with Midazolam • Consider vagal maneuvers, but do not
0.05mg/kg IV/IO slowly delay other treatments
• Max dose: 1mg • If vascular access readily available,
• Do not delay cardioversion if Adenosine 0.1mg/kg IV/IO
patient unstable • Max first dose: 6mg
• Synchronized Cardioversion: 1J/kg • MR x1 double the dose (0.2mg/kg)
• If not effective, increase to 2J/kg • Max second dose: 12mg
• ☎ PHYSICIAN CONSULT for • Follow each with rapid 10ml NS flush
Amiodarone if no response to • Pre-medicate with Midazolam
0.05mg/kg IV/IO slowly
cardioversion
• 5mg/kg IV over 20-60 minutes • Max dose: 1mg
• Do not delay cardioversion if patient
unstable
• Synchronized Cardioversion: 1J/kg
• If not effective, increase to 2J/kg
SPECIAL CONSIDERATION
Reversible causes:
• Hypovolemia
• Hypoxia
• Hydrogen Ion (Acidosis)
• Hypo/Hyperkalemia
• Hypothermia
• Tension Pneumothorax
• Tamponade (cardiac)
• Toxins
• Thrombus
• Trauma
